title: Networth based bidding would have meant the entire debt burden of AI would have fallen on the new private owner. But now,post AI sale,the govt is still responsible for the bulk of debt repayment (Rs.46,000 cr).Debt was so huge that no private bidder would bear entire debt burden.
author: mkvenu1

title: Divestment Secy says AI’s networth had turned negative at Rs.33,000 cr. So a networth based bidding would have failed. So bids were on the basis of how much outstanding debt of AI was bidder willing to take over. Tatas agreed to pay Rs.15,000 cr out of total debt of Rs.61,000 cr.
author: mkvenu1

title: Air India sold to Tatas for enterprise value of Rs.18,000 cr. Tatas take over Rs.15,000 cr of current AI debt. Govt says Air India was losing Rs.20 crore a day.Govt/taxpayer pumped Rs.1.10 lakh crore to fund AI losses since 2009-10. This bleeding stops now, says Secy Divestment.
